Key Match Events: Arizona's bid for a second World Series title was stopped by a 5-0 loss to the Texas Rangers in Game 5 on Wednesday night
The Rangers had a 10-0 lead after three innings and won 11-7 to take a 3-1 Series lead
Corey Seager's two-run homer in the ninth inning in Game 1
Adolis García's walk-off homer in the 11th inning in Game 1
Post-Match Reflections: Torey Lovullo: 'You want to be the last team standing. You want to be in the middle of a pile and have everybody pile on top of you. That’s the best feeling in the world'
Zac Gallen: 'I would have rather given up 1,000 runs and still win the game'
Christian Walker: 'There’s always going to be things to look back and wish it turned out differently, but at the end of the day, we gave everything we had and there’s no regrets'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Two years removed from losing 110 games, the Diamondbacks shook off a midseason swoon to reach the playoffs for the first time since 2017
The Rangers exposed Arizona’s weaknesses in the Fall Classic
Arizona managed to overcome its lack of depth in its rotation through the first three rounds of the playoffs, but it cost them in the World Series
Arizona’s bullpen, a strength down the stretch of the regular season, also faltered in a Game 1 loss
Others: Ketel Marte had a huge playoff run. He had at least one hit in the first 16 games, giving him a record 20-game postseason hit streak to begin his career
Marte struck out looking for the final out of Game 5, but he walked three times to extend his on-base streak to 21 games
That is tied with Daniel Murphy’s 21 games from 2015-17 for the second-longest such streak to begin a postseason career, trailing Boog Powell’s 25 games from 1966-71
Corbin Carroll, the favorite for NL Rookie of the Year, went 5 for 23 in the World Series with no homers
Arizona had five hits and went 0 for 9 with runners in scoring position in Game 5
Walker mishandled a ball that led to a five-run third inning in Game 4 and center fielder Alek Thomas overran a ball in the ninth inning, allowing a run to score in the four-run inning in Game 5
